dn14:1.1.3.pli: Atha kho sambahulna bhikkhna pacchbhatta piaptapaikkantna karerimaalame sannisinnna sannipatitna pubbenivsapaisayutt dhamm kath udapdi:
dn14:1.1.3.en: Then after the meal, on return from alms-round, several senior mendicants sat together in the pavilion by the kari tree and this [38;5;121mDhamma[0m talk on the subject of past lives came up among them,

dn14:1.3.1.pli: Iccheyytha no tumhe, bhikkhave, pubbenivsapaisayutta dhammi katha sotunti?
dn14:1.3.1.en: Would you like to hear a [38;5;121mDhamma[0m talk on the subject of past lives?

dn14:1.3.3.pli: ya bhagav pubbenivsapaisayutta dhammi katha kareyya, bhagavato sutv bhikkh dhressantti.
dn14:1.3.3.en: Let the Buddha give a [38;5;121mDhamma[0m talk on the subject of past lives. The mendicants will listen and remember it.

dn14:1.15.5.pli: Iccheyytha no tumhe, bhikkhave, bhiyyoso mattya pubbenivsapaisayutta dhammi katha sotunti?
dn14:1.15.5.en: Would you like to hear a further [38;5;121mDhamma[0m talk on the subject of past lives?

dn14:1.15.7.pli: ya bhagav bhiyyoso mattya pubbenivsapaisayutta dhammi katha kareyya, bhagavato sutv bhikkh dhressantti.
dn14:1.15.7.en: Let the Buddha give a further [38;5;121mDhamma[0m talk on the subject of past lives. The mendicants will listen and remember it.

dn14:3.1.8.pli: Ahaceva kho pana [38;5;121mdhamma[0m deseyya, pare ca me na jneyyu; so mamassa kilamatho, s mamassa vihesti.
dn14:3.1.8.en: And if I were to teach the [38;5;121mDhamma[0m, others might not understand me, which would be wearying and troublesome for me.

dn14:3.2.10.pli: Itiha, bhikkhave, vipassissa bhagavato arahato sammsambuddhassa paisacikkhato appossukkatya citta nami, no [38;5;121mdhamma[0mdesanya.
dn14:3.2.10.en: So, as the Buddha Vipass reflected like this, his mind inclined to remaining passive, not to teaching the [38;5;121mDhamma[0m.

dn14:3.2.12.pli: nassati vata bho loko, vinassati vata bho loko, yatra hi nma vipassissa bhagavato arahato sammsambuddhassa appossukkatya citta namati, no [38;5;121mdhamma[0mdesanyti.
dn14:3.2.12.en: Oh my goodness! The world will be lost, the world will perish! For the mind of the Realized One Vipass, the perfected one, the fully awakened Buddha, inclines to remaining passive, not to teaching the [38;5;121mDhamma[0m.

dn14:3.3.2.en: Sir, let the Blessed One teach the [38;5;121mDhamma[0m! Let the Holy One teach the [38;5;121mDhamma[0m!

dn14:3.4.9.pli: Ahaceva kho pana [38;5;121mdhamma[0m deseyya, pare ca me na jneyyu; so mamassa kilamatho, s mamassa vihesti.
dn14:3.4.9.en: If I were to teach the [38;5;121mDhamma[0m, others might not understand me, which would be wearying and troublesome for me.

dn14:3.4.19.pli: Itiha me, brahme, paisacikkhato appossukkatya citta nami, no [38;5;121mdhamma[0mdesanyti.
dn14:3.4.19.en: So, as I reflected like this, my mind inclined to remaining passive, not to teaching the [38;5;121mDhamma[0m.

dn14:3.7.10.en: Let the Blessed One teach the [38;5;121mDhamma[0m!

dn14:3.7.17.pli: Atha kho so, bhikkhave, mahbrahm: katvakso khomhi vipassin bhagavat arahat sammsambuddhena [38;5;121mdhamma[0mdesanyti vipassi bhagavanta arahanta sammsambuddha abhivdetv padakkhia katv tattheva antaradhyi.
dn14:3.7.17.en: Then the Great Brahm, knowing that his request for the Buddha Vipass to teach the [38;5;121mDhamma[0m had been granted, bowed and respectfully circled him, keeping him on his right, before vanishing right there.

dn14:3.11.6.pli: evameva khaassa ca rjaputtassa tissassa ca purohitaputtassa tasmiyeva sane viraja vtamala [38;5;121mdhamma[0mcakkhu udapdi:
dn14:3.11.6.en: in that very seat the stainless, immaculate vision of the [38;5;121mDhamma[0m arose in the kings son Khaa and the high priests son Tissa:

dn14:3.12.1.pli: Te dihadhamm pattadhamm viditadhamm pariyoghadhamm tiavicikicch vigatakathakath vesrajjappatt aparappaccay satthussane vipassi bhagavanta arahanta sammsambuddha etadavocu:
dn14:3.12.1.en: They saw, attained, understood, and fathomed the [38;5;121mDhamma[0m. They went beyond doubt, got rid of indecision, and became self-assured and independent of others regarding the Teachers instructions. They said to the Buddha Vipass,

dn14:3.13.2.pli: Te vipass bhagav araha sammsambuddho dhammiy kathya sandassesi samdapesi samuttejesi sampahasesi;
dn14:3.13.2.en: Then the Buddha Vipass educated, encouraged, fired up, and inspired them with a [38;5;121mDhamma[0m talk.

dn14:3.15.6.pli: evameva tesa caturstipasahassna tasmiyeva sane viraja vtamala [38;5;121mdhamma[0mcakkhu udapdi:
dn14:3.15.6.en: in that very seat the stainless, immaculate vision of the [38;5;121mDhamma[0m arose in those 84,000 people:

dn14:3.16.1.pli: Te dihadhamm pattadhamm viditadhamm pariyoghadhamm tiavicikicch vigatakathakath vesrajjappatt aparappaccay satthussane vipassi bhagavanta arahanta sammsambuddha etadavocu:
dn14:3.16.1.en: They saw, attained, understood, and fathomed the [38;5;121mDhamma[0m. They went beyond doubt, got rid of indecision, and became self-assured and independent of others regarding the Teachers instructions. They said to the Buddha Vipass,

dn14:3.18.2.pli: vipass kira bhagav araha sammsambuddho bandhumati rjadhni anuppatto kheme migadye viharati, [38;5;121mdhamma[0mca kira desetti.
dn14:3.18.2.en: It seems the Blessed One Vipass, the perfected one, the fully awakened Buddha, has arrived at Bandhumat and is staying in the deer park named Sanctuary. And he is teaching the [38;5;121mDhamma[0m!

dn14:3.18.3.pli: Atha kho, bhikkhave, tni caturstipabbajitasahassni yena bandhumat rjadhn yena khemo migadyo yena vipass bhagav araha sammsambuddho tenupasakamisu; upasakamitv vipassi bhagavanta arahanta sammsambuddha abhivdetv ekamanta nisdisu.
dn14:3.18.3.en: Then they too went to see the Buddha Vipass, realized the [38;5;121mDhamma[0m, went forth, and became freed from defilements.

dn14:3.22.6.pli: desetha, bhikkhave, [38;5;121mdhamma[0m dikalya majjhekalya pariyosnakalya sttha sabyajana kevalaparipua parisuddha brahmacariya paksetha.
dn14:3.22.6.en: Teach the [38;5;121mDhamma[0m thats good in the beginning, good in the middle, and good in the end, meaningful and well-phrased. And reveal a spiritual practice thats entirely full and pure.

dn14:3.26.3.pli: desetha, bhikkhave, [38;5;121mdhamma[0m dikalya majjhekalya pariyosnakalya sttha sabyajana kevalaparipua parisuddha brahmacariya paksetha.
dn14:3.26.3.en: Teach the [38;5;121mDhamma[0m thats good in the beginning, good in the middle, and good in the end, meaningful and well-phrased. And reveal a spiritual practice thats entirely full and pure.

dn14:3.29.18.pli: Vipassissa, mris, bhagavato arahato sammsambuddhassa eva abhinikkhamana ahosi eva pabbajj eva padhna eva abhisambodhi eva [38;5;121mdhamma[0mcakkappavattana.
dn14:3.29.18.en: And such was his renunciation, such his going forth, such his striving, such his awakening, and such his rolling forth of the wheel of [38;5;121mDhamma[0m.

dn14:3.30.13.pli: Bhagavato, mris, eva abhinikkhamana ahosi eva pabbajj eva padhna eva abhisambodhi eva [38;5;121mdhamma[0mcakkappavattana.
dn14:3.30.13.en: And such was your renunciation, such your going forth, such your striving, such your awakening, and such your rolling forth of the wheel of [38;5;121mDhamma[0m.

dn16:1.12.1.pli: Tatra suda bhagav rjagahe viharanto gijjhake pabbate etadeva bahula bhikkhna dhammi katha karoti:
dn16:1.12.1.en: And while staying there at the Vultures Peak the Buddha often gave this [38;5;121mDhamma[0m talk to the mendicants:

dn16:1.14.2.en: And while staying there, too, he often gave this [38;5;121mDhamma[0m talk to the mendicants:

dn16:1.18.1.en: And while staying at Nand, too, the Buddha often gave this [38;5;121mDhamma[0m talk to the mendicants:

dn16:1.25.1.pli: Atha kho bhagav paligmike upsake bahudeva ratti dhammiy kathya sandassetv samdapetv samuttejetv sampahasetv uyyojesi:
dn16:1.25.1.en: The Buddha spent most of the night educating, encouraging, firing up, and inspiring the lay followers of Paligma with a [38;5;121mDhamma[0m talk. Then he dismissed them,

dn16:2.4.1.pli: Tatrapi suda bhagav koigme viharanto etadeva bahula bhikkhna dhammi katha karoti:
dn16:2.4.1.en: And while staying at Koigma, too, the Buddha often gave this [38;5;121mDhamma[0m talk to the mendicants:

dn16:2.8.3.pli: Tasmtihnanda, dhammdsa nma [38;5;121mdhamma[0mpariyya desessmi, yena samanngato ariyasvako kakhamno attanva attna bykareyya:
dn16:2.8.3.en: So nanda, I will teach you the explanation of the [38;5;121mDhamma[0m called the mirror of the teaching. A noble disciple who has this may declare of themselves:

dn16:2.10.1.pli: Tatrapi suda bhagav ntike viharanto gijakvasathe etadeva bahula bhikkhna dhammi katha karoti:
dn16:2.10.1.en: And while staying there in Ndika the Buddha often gave this [38;5;121mDhamma[0m talk to the mendicants:

dn16:2.14.4.pli: Ekamanta nisinna kho ambapli gaika bhagav dhammiy kathya sandassesi samdapesi samuttejesi sampahasesi.
dn16:2.14.4.en: The Buddha educated, encouraged, fired up, and inspired her with a [38;5;121mDhamma[0m talk.

dn16:2.18.2.pli: Ekamanta nisinne kho te licchav bhagav dhammiy kathya sandassesi samdapesi samuttejesi sampahasesi.
dn16:2.18.2.en: and the Buddha educated, encouraged, fired up, and inspired them with a [38;5;121mDhamma[0m talk.

dn16:2.19.9.pli: Atha kho bhagav ambapli gaika dhammiy kathya sandassetv samdapetv samuttejetv sampahasetv uhysan pakkmi.
dn16:2.19.9.en: Then the Buddha educated, encouraged, fired up, and inspired her with a [38;5;121mDhamma[0m talk, after which he got up from his seat and left.

dn16:2.20.1.pli: Tatrapi suda bhagav vesliya viharanto ambaplivane etadeva bahula bhikkhna dhammi katha karoti:
dn16:2.20.1.en: And while staying at Vesl, too, the Buddha often gave this [38;5;121mDhamma[0m talk to the mendicants:

dn16:2.25.2.pli: Desito, nanda, may dhammo anantara abhira karitv.
dn16:2.25.2.en: Ive taught the [38;5;121mDhamma[0m without making any distinction between secret and public teachings.

dn16:3.18.1.pli: Puna capara, nanda, yad tathgato anuttara [38;5;121mdhamma[0mcakka pavatteti, tadya pathav kampati sakampati sampakampati sampavedhati.
dn16:3.18.1.en: Furthermore, when the Realized One rolls forth the supreme Wheel of [38;5;121mDhamma[0m, the earth shakes and rocks and trembles.

dn16:3.22.4.pli: Dhammiy kathya sandassemi samdapemi samuttejemi sampahasemi.
dn16:3.22.4.en: I educated, encouraged, fired up, and inspired them with a [38;5;121mDhamma[0m talk.

dn16:3.22.7.pli: Dhammiy kathya sandassetv samdapetv samuttejetv sampahasetv antaradhymi.
dn16:3.22.7.en: And when my [38;5;121mDhamma[0m talk was finished I vanished.

dn16:3.23.11.pli: Dhammiy kathya sandassemi samdapemi samuttejemi sampahasemi.
dn16:3.23.11.en: I educated, encouraged, fired up, and inspired them with a [38;5;121mDhamma[0m talk.

dn16:3.23.14.en: And when my [38;5;121mDhamma[0m talk was finished I vanished.

dn16:4.12.1.en: And while staying at the nanda shrine, too, the Buddha often gave this [38;5;121mDhamma[0m talk to the mendicants:

dn16:4.14.3.en: The Buddha educated, encouraged, fired up, and inspired him with a [38;5;121mDhamma[0m talk.

dn16:4.19.5.en: Then the Buddha educated, encouraged, fired up, and inspired him with a [38;5;121mDhamma[0m talk, after which he got up from his seat and left.

dn16:4.36.1.en: Then the Buddha educated, encouraged, fired up, and inspired Pukkusa the Malla with a [38;5;121mDhamma[0m talk,

dn16:5.8.5.pli: Idha tathgatena anuttara [38;5;121mdhamma[0mcakka pavattitanti, nanda, saddhassa kulaputtassa dassanya savejanya hna.
dn16:5.8.5.en: Thinking: Here the supreme Wheel of [38;5;121mDhamma[0m was rolled forth by the Realized One!that is an inspiring place.

dn16:5.8.9.pli: idha tathgato jtotipi, idha tathgato anuttara sammsambodhi abhisambuddhotipi, idha tathgatena anuttara [38;5;121mdhamma[0mcakka pavattitantipi, idha tathgato anupdisesya nibbnadhtuy parinibbutotipi.
dn16:5.8.9.en: Here the Realized One was born! and Here the Realized One became awakened as a supreme fully awakened Buddha! and Here the supreme Wheel of [38;5;121mDhamma[0m was rolled forth by the Realized One! and Here the Realized One became fully extinguished through the natural principle of extinguishment, without anything left over!

dn16:6.11.14.pli: Atha kho yasm ca anuruddho yasm ca nando ta rattvasesa dhammiy kathya vtinmesu.
dn16:6.11.14.en: nanda and Anuruddha spent the rest of the night talking about [38;5;121mDhamma[0m.

mn139:13.16.en: Flattering and rebuking without teaching [38;5;121mDhamma[0m is a principle beset by pain, harm, stress, and fever, and it is the wrong way.

mn139:13.19.en: Neither flattering nor rebuking, and just teaching [38;5;121mDhamma[0m is a principle free of pain, harm, stress, and fever, and it is the right way.

an3.61:9.1.pli: Aya kho pana, bhikkhave, may dhammo desito aniggahito asakiliho anupavajjo appaikuho samaehi brhmaehi vihi.
an3.61:9.1.en: But the [38;5;121mDhamma[0m that Ive taught is irrefutable, uncorrupted, beyond reproach, and not scorned by sensible ascetics and brahmins.

an3.61:9.2.pli: Katamo ca, bhikkhave, may dhammo desito aniggahito asakiliho anupavajjo appaikuho samaehi brhmaehi vihi?
an3.61:9.2.en: What is the [38;5;121mDhamma[0m that Ive taught?

an3.61:9.6.en: These are the four noble truths: this is the [38;5;121mDhamma[0m Ive taught that is irrefutable, uncorrupted, beyond reproach, and is not scorned by sensible ascetics and brahmins.

mn91:21.6.pli: Te tena bhot gotamena dhammiy kathya sandassit samdapit samuttejit sampahasit uhysan pakkamanti avalokayamnyeva avijahitatt.
mn91:21.6.en: And when theyve been inspired with a [38;5;121mDhamma[0m talk by Master Gotama they get up from their seats and leave looking back at him alone, and not forgetting their lesson.

mn91:22.1.pli: Addasma kho maya, bho, ta bhavanta gotama gacchanta, addasma hita, addasma antaraghara pavisanta, addasma antaraghare nisinna tuhbhta, addasma antaraghare bhujanta, addasma bhuttvi nisinna tuhbhta, addasma bhuttvi anumodanta, addasma rma gacchanta, addasma rmagata nisinna tuhbhta, addasma rmagata parisati [38;5;121mdhamma[0m desenta.
mn91:22.1.en: I have seen Master Gotama walking and standing; entering inhabited areas, and sitting and eating there; sitting silently after eating, and expressing appreciation; going to the monastery, sitting silently there, and teaching [38;5;121mDhamma[0m to an assembly there.

mn91:24.8.pli: So [38;5;121mdhamma[0m deseti dikalya majjhekalya pariyosnakalya sttha sabyajana, kevalaparipua parisuddha brahmacariya pakseti.
mn91:24.8.en: He teaches [38;5;121mDhamma[0m thats good in the beginning, good in the middle, and good in the end, meaningful and well-phrased. And he reveals a spiritual practice thats entirely full and pure.

mn91:36.7.en: in that very seat the stainless, immaculate vision of the [38;5;121mDhamma[0m arose in the brahmin Brahmyu:

mn91:36.9.en: Then Brahmyu saw, attained, understood, and fathomed the [38;5;121mDhamma[0m. He went beyond doubt, got rid of indecision, and became self-assured and independent of others regarding the Teachers instructions. He said to the Buddha:

dn33:2.1.128.en: Firstly, the Teacher or a respected spiritual companion teaches [38;5;121mDhamma[0m to a mendicant.

dn33:2.1.129.en: That mendicant feels inspired by the meaning and the teaching in that [38;5;121mDhamma[0m, no matter how the Teacher or a respected spiritual companion teaches it.

dn33:2.1.136.pli: Yath yath, vuso, bhikkhuno aatara samdhinimitta suggahita hoti sumanasikata spadhrita suppaividdha paya tath tath so tasmi dhamme atthapaisaved ca hoti [38;5;121mdhamma[0mpaisaved ca.
dn33:2.1.136.en: That mendicant feels inspired by the meaning and the teaching in that [38;5;121mDhamma[0m, no matter how a meditation subject as a foundation of immersion is properly grasped, attended, borne in mind, and comprehended with wisdom.

dn33:3.2.44.pli: Idhvuso, tathgato ca loke uppanno hoti araha sammsambuddho, dhammo ca desiyati opasamiko parinibbniko sambodhagm sugatappavedito.
dn33:3.2.44.en: Firstly, a Realized One has arisen in the world. He teaches the [38;5;121mDhamma[0m leading to peace, extinguishment, awakening, as proclaimed by the Holy One.

sn35.75:7.1.en: I understand that the Buddha has taught the [38;5;121mDhamma[0m for the purpose of complete extinguishment by not grasping.

sn35.75:8.2.pli: Sdhu kho tva, bhikkhu, anupdparinibbnattha may [38;5;121mdhamma[0m desita jnsi.
sn35.75:8.2.en: Its good that you understand that Ive taught the [38;5;121mDhamma[0m for the purpose of complete extinguishment by not grasping.

sn35.133:1.4.pli: Ekamanta nisinna kho ta mavaka yasm udy dhammiy kathya sandassesi samdapesi samuttejesi sampahasesi.
sn35.133:1.4.en: Udy educated, encouraged, fired up, and inspired that student with a [38;5;121mDhamma[0m talk.

sn35.133:1.7.pli: Samao udy [38;5;121mdhamma[0m deseti dikalya majjhekalya pariyosnakalya, sttha sabyajana kevalaparipua parisuddha brahmacariya paksetti.
sn35.133:1.7.en: The ascetic Udy teaches [38;5;121mDhamma[0m thats good in the beginning, good in the middle, and good in the end, meaningful and well-phrased. And he reveals a spiritual practice thats entirely full and pure.

sn35.133:4.2.pli: Samao panudy bhaa, samaa, [38;5;121mdhamma[0mnti vutto samno bhavissati, bhagini, samayoti vatv uhysan pakkantoti.
sn35.133:4.2.en: But when I asked him to preach the [38;5;121mDhamma[0m he just said that there would be an occasion for that, and then he got up and left.

an8.21:4.7.pli: evameva kho me tasmiyeva sane viraja vtamala [38;5;121mdhamma[0mcakkhu udapdi:
an8.21:4.7.en: in that very seat the stainless, immaculate vision of the [38;5;121mDhamma[0m arose in me:

an8.21:4.9.pli: So kho aha, bhante, dihadhammo pattadhammo viditadhammo pariyoghadhammo tiavicikiccho vigatakathakatho vesrajjappatto aparappaccayo satthussane
an8.21:4.9.en: I saw, attained, understood, and fathomed the [38;5;121mDhamma[0m. I went beyond doubt, got rid of indecision, and became self-assured and independent of others regarding the Teachers instructions.

an8.21:8.1.pli: So ce, bhante, me yasm [38;5;121mdhamma[0m deseti;
an8.21:8.1.en: If that venerable teaches me the [38;5;121mDhamma[0m,

an8.21:8.3.pli: No ce me so yasm [38;5;121mdhamma[0m deseti, ahamassa [38;5;121mdhamma[0m desemi.
an8.21:8.3.en: But if they dont teach me the [38;5;121mDhamma[0m, I teach them.

an8.29:1.4.pli: Idha, bhikkhave, tathgato ca loke uppanno hoti araha sammsambuddho vijjcaraasampanno sugato lokavid anuttaro purisadammasrathi satth devamanussna buddho bhagav, dhammo ca desiyati opasamiko parinibbniko sambodhagm sugatappavedito;
an8.29:1.4.en: Firstly, a Realized One has arisen in the worldperfected, a fully awakened Buddha, accomplished in knowledge and conduct, holy, knower of the world, supreme guide for those who wish to train, teacher of gods and humans, awakened, blessed. He teaches the [38;5;121mDhamma[0m leading to peace, extinguishment, awakening, as proclaimed by the Holy One.

an8.29:8.2.pli: Dhammo ca na desiyati opasamiko parinibbniko sambodhagm sugatappavedito. Ayaca puggalo majjhimesu janapadesu paccjto hoti, so ca hoti paav ajao aneamgo paibalo subhsitadubbhsitassa atthamatu.
an8.29:8.2.en: So he doesnt teach the [38;5;121mDhamma[0m leading to peace, extinguishment, awakening, as proclaimed by the Holy One. And a person is reborn in a central country. And theyre wise, bright, clever, and able to distinguish what is well said from what is poorly said.

an8.29:10.4.pli: Dhammo ca desiyati opasamiko parinibbniko sambodhagm sugatappavedito. Ayaca puggalo majjhimesu janapadesu paccjto hoti, so ca hoti paav ajao aneamgo paibalo subhsitadubbhsitassa atthamatu.
an8.29:10.4.en: He teaches the [38;5;121mDhamma[0m leading to peace, extinguishment, awakening, as proclaimed by the Holy One. And a person is reborn in a central country. And theyre wise, bright, clever, and able to distinguish what is well said from what is poorly said.

an8.22:4.8.pli: evameva kho me tasmiyeva sane viraja vtamala [38;5;121mdhamma[0mcakkhu udapdi:
an8.22:4.8.en: in that very seat the stainless, immaculate vision of the [38;5;121mDhamma[0m arose in me:

an8.22:4.10.pli: So kho aha, bhante, dihadhammo pattadhammo viditadhammo pariyoghadhammo tiavicikiccho vigatakathakatho vesrajjappatto aparappaccayo satthussane tattheva buddhaca [38;5;121mdhamma[0mca saghaca saraa agamsi, brahmacariyapacamni ca sikkhpadni samdiyi.
an8.22:4.10.en: I saw, attained, understood, and fathomed the [38;5;121mDhamma[0m. I went beyond doubt, got rid of indecision, and became self-assured and independent of others regarding the Teachers instructions. Right there I went for refuge to the Buddha, his teaching, and the Sagha. And I undertook the five training rules with celibacy as the fifth.

an8.22:7.3.en: If that venerable teaches me the [38;5;121mDhamma[0m,

an8.22:7.5.pli: No ce me so yasm [38;5;121mdhamma[0m deseti, ahamassa [38;5;121mdhamma[0m desemi.
an8.22:7.5.en: But if they dont teach me the [38;5;121mDhamma[0m, I teach them.

sn55.7:1.8.pli: So [38;5;121mdhamma[0m deseti dikalya majjhekalya pariyosnakalya sttha sabyajana, kevalaparipua parisuddha brahmacariya pakseti.
sn55.7:1.8.en: He teaches [38;5;121mDhamma[0m thats good in the beginning, good in the middle, and good in the end, meaningful and well-phrased. And he reveals a spiritual practice thats entirely full and pure.

sn55.7:2.4.pli: Tesa no bhava gotamo amhka evakmna evachandna evaadhippyna tath [38;5;121mdhamma[0m desetu yath maya puttasambdhasayana ajjhvaseyyma pe sugati sagga loka upapajjeyymti.
sn55.7:2.4.en: Given that we have such wishes, may the Buddha teach us the [38;5;121mDhamma[0m so that we may achieve them.

sn55.7:3.1.en: Householders, I will teach you an explanation of the [38;5;121mDhamma[0m thats relevant to oneself.

sn55.7:4.1.en: And what is the explanation of the [38;5;121mDhamma[0m thats relevant to oneself?

sn22.1:4.4.pli: Alattha no ajja bhagavato sammukh dhammi katha savanyti?
sn22.1:4.4.en: Did you get to hear a [38;5;121mDhamma[0m talk in the Buddhas presence today?

sn22.1:5.2.pli: Idnha, bhante, bhagavat dhammiy kathya amatena abhisittoti.
sn22.1:5.2.en: Just now the Buddha anointed me with the deathless ambrosia of a [38;5;121mDhamma[0m talk.

sn22.1:5.3.pli: Yath katha pana tva, gahapati, bhagavat dhammiy kathya amatena abhisittoti?
sn22.1:5.3.en: But what kind of ambrosial [38;5;121mDhamma[0m talk has the Buddha anointed you with?

sn22.1:6.8.pli: Eva khvha, bhante, bhagavat dhammiy kathya amatena abhisittoti.
sn22.1:6.8.en: Thats the ambrosial [38;5;121mDhamma[0m talk that the Buddha anointed me with.

an4.191:2.6.pli: api ca kho bhikkhu iddhim cetovasippatto devaparisya [38;5;121mdhamma[0m deseti.
an4.191:2.6.en: However, a mendicant with psychic powers, who has achieved mastery of the mind, teaches [38;5;121mDhamma[0m to the assembly of gods.

an4.191:3.5.pli: Tassa tattha na heva kho sukhino [38;5;121mdhamma[0mpad plavanti, napi bhikkhu iddhim cetovasippatto devaparisya [38;5;121mdhamma[0m deseti;
an4.191:3.5.en: But passages of the teaching dont come back to them when theyre happy, nor does a mendicant with psychic powers  teach [38;5;121mDhamma[0m to the assembly of gods.

an4.191:3.6.pli: api ca kho devaputto devaparisya [38;5;121mdhamma[0m deseti.
an4.191:3.6.en: However, a god teaches [38;5;121mDhamma[0m to the assembly of gods.

an4.191:4.5.pli: Tassa tattha na heva kho sukhino [38;5;121mdhamma[0mpad plavanti, napi bhikkhu iddhim cetovasippatto devaparisya [38;5;121mdhamma[0m deseti, napi devaputto devaparisya [38;5;121mdhamma[0m deseti;
an4.191:4.5.en: But passages of the teaching dont come back to them when theyre happy, and neither a mendicant with psychic powers  nor a god teaches [38;5;121mDhamma[0m to the assembly of gods.

sn22.90:1.3.pli: ovadantu ma yasmanto ther, anussantu ma yasmanto ther, karontu me yasmanto ther dhammi katha, yathha [38;5;121mdhamma[0m passeyyanti.
sn22.90:1.3.en: May the venerable senior mendicants advise me and instruct me! May they give me a [38;5;121mDhamma[0m talk so that I can see the teaching!

sn22.90:3.17.pli: Ko nu kho me tath [38;5;121mdhamma[0m deseyya yathha [38;5;121mdhamma[0m passeyyanti.
sn22.90:3.17.en: Who can teach me the [38;5;121mDhamma[0m so that I can see the teaching?

sn22.90:4.2.pli: aya kho yasm nando kosambiya viharati ghositrme satthu ceva savaito sambhvito ca vina sabrahmacrna, pahoti ca me yasm nando tath [38;5;121mdhamma[0m desetu yathha [38;5;121mdhamma[0m passeyya;
sn22.90:4.2.en: The Venerable nanda is staying near Kosambi, in Ghositas Monastery. Hes praised by the Buddha and esteemed by his sensible spiritual companions. Hes quite capable of teaching me the [38;5;121mDhamma[0m so that I can see the teaching.

sn22.90:7.5.en: May Venerable nanda advise me and instruct me! May he give me a [38;5;121mDhamma[0m talk so that I can see the teaching!
